website_summaries.verdict: The 2-in-1 seat-belt cutter and window hammer is very basic and small, but different users can find their preferred method of attachment.
pros: Accessory kit includes cable tie, lanyard, and sun visor attachments
cons: Spring mechanism for window hammer may fail

customer_reviews.title: Beware -- Items sent were FAKE
customer_reviews.text: I own a real Resqme tool (see photo of black item) and ordered 4 more in yellow for our other vehicles. Despite advertising them as genuine, they were cheap fakes repackaged in a little baggie with a sticker saying they were original Resqme tools (see photo of fake yellow tool received). I confirmed with the manufacturer that ALL of their items have a logo and they are sending me genuine replacements. So thank you Resqme for excellent customer service and boo to "Pop's General Shoppe" for pedaling fakes that could have jeopardized my and my family's safety.
customer_reviews.author: AG

customer_reviews.title: Questionable reliability and no warranty support.
customer_reviews.text: I purchased a two pack of the resqme escape tool less than a year ago. I used the included cable ties to attach them to the rear-view mirrors in my vehicles. A couple of weeks I noticed the tool was rattling around so I detached it for a closer inspection. The spring mechanism had failed and the spring was just rattling around loose inside. I reached out to the company two weeks ago to make a warranty claim but I have not heard a response. TLDR Negative review for product failure. Reliability is the single most important thing with a tool like this. Negative review for poor (non-existent) customer support/service.
customer_reviews.author: ZDteacher

customer_reviews.title: Great idea but poor quality
customer_reviews.text: I purchased 4 of these and so far 3 have broken where the clip connects to the product. When I contacted the seller they advised they were aware of the design defect and do not cover the item under warranty since they consider it still operational. I could not disagree with them more. I have been a full time paramedic for over 18 years and I can say with certainty that without the ability to secure the window punch/cutter to a fixed location such as the ignition key, one's chances of locating it in a timely manner during an emergency is almost zero. Save your money and buy something that can be easily located and used in a timely fashion.
customer_reviews.author: AuggieDoggie

customer_reviews.title: peace of mind
customer_reviews.text: I don't want anything added to my keyring so I installed them with Velcro tape to the center dash/console of our vehicles. That way both driver and front passenger always know where they are and has one within reach at all times.
customer_reviews.author: Inspector Gadget

customer_reviews.title: BROKEN without any use!
customer_reviews.text: BROKEN without any use! I was amazed by the advertisements and bought 2, one for me, the other for my dad. I put it in my car for emergency uses. However, today I just realized that it was broken!!! The blade is exposed to the outside and the key ring just fell off! VERY DISAPPOINTED. Can't imagine what if I need to use it in an emergency only to find that it was broken! Stay away from this product and look for something else.
customer_reviews.author: Cooper

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't Work At All
customer_reviews.text: I would not suggest this product at all!!! I'm in the law enforcement field and tried 2 of them today on a call. They failed to break the rear passenger side window! All this simply did was create a slight mark on the window which looked like a small rock had hit it.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica Eppard

customer_reviews.title: Resqme - Excellent
customer_reviews.text: We tried it out on a shot glass. The side of the glass itself seems to be thicker than a window and it broke it just fine. We tried the bottom of the shot glass but it did not break. We also cut an old piece of heavy cloth similar to a seat belt and it worked just fine (no video). One is put on my windshield with the zip tie it came with, and the other is on my car keys. Overall, this seems to be a great product that I hope to never use.
customer_reviews.author: April

customer_reviews.title: They literally pack a punch
customer_reviews.text: These things are AWESOME. I am in fire school and my buddy has one. I tried 4 different glass breakers and this one was the most controlled. Your hand doesn't go through the window like most of the others, just a quick pop and you can clear the glass out. The seatbelt cutter also worked perfectly, cuts through them like butter. I ordered several more for myself as soon as I got home.
customer_reviews.author: Parker

customer_reviews.title: Life saving value!
customer_reviews.text: I've given one to my fiance! I'm an LAFD CERT member and while this isn't one of my SAR tools as it's too light for repeated heavy use, I've tested it with success for its intended purpose. It's not just for saving my life, but combined with the gloves, shears, CPR Mask & Tourniquet I EDC, and the EMT bag & fire extinguisher in my trunk, this tool could very well be used to save another person's life. The ability to have a glass punch & rescue cutter on your person for such a low price, low weight, and low size considering that it can save not only your life but someone else's justifies buying several. Can't recommend enough.
customer_reviews.author: KnifemakingPrepper

customer_reviews.title: Great product for size
customer_reviews.text: Full disclosure I have not used on glass but it packs a punch when I tested it on wood and am confident it will break the glass. Test it out on wood first so you know how much pressure it really takes to use. It is more then I imagined and could be difficult for some or in certain instances such as wet hands. The blade cover is also a bit difficult to remove. Overall a great product for the size but the size also worries me. It could easily be lost in an accident and harder to use in certain situations.
customer_reviews.author: David J Huffman

customer_reviews.title: Buy this for the women you love
customer_reviews.text: Recently there was a horrible story in the news about a woman kidnapped and killed by someone she thought was an uber. She was locked in and could not break the tinted window to yell for help. If only the poor girl would have had this in her purse. Ladies, please check your license plates when getting in ride share cars. Read the directions on this so you know how to use it.
customer_reviews.author: Anmian

customer_reviews.title: Easy peasy "install"
customer_reviews.text: I was nervous about how to attach them to my car, I didn't realize until I saw them in person that a) they come with their own key rings and zip ties and b) the black part protecting the blade slides off. So, you key ring or zip tie them to your keys, rear view mirror, back of baby car seat, etc., and when needed just tug firmly. Feel like quality, and I tested the window punch on cardboard. I feel better having a couple in my car and one on my keychain.
customer_reviews.author: Angela F

customer_reviews.title: Broke right away.  Poor quality.  Heed the bad reviews.
customer_reviews.text: Like several other reviewers, the spring / pin / punch part broke when I tested the tool. The only thing worse than not having a safety tool, is having a poor quality tool that breaks and isn't usable. This thing should be recalled. Resqme has made a bad product and should be shamed into fixing it OR not selling it.
customer_reviews.author: Customer Reviewer

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what you're looking for! Fast and effective!
customer_reviews.text: This is the best of the escape tools! First, its small and is easy to use with only the left hand. Second, remove the key ring and zip tie it directly to the left stem (turn signal on most). Already in the proper position, just pull down to release into left land and go straight to the driver window and "pop" the glass. Boom! Glass gone. Now release your belt it use the belt cutter on the tool. I've had these on every vehicle for years bc we are in Florida and water is everywhere. Practice is easy on a piece of wood, it resets itself and will reattach to holder clip.
customer_reviews.author: VC

customer_reviews.title: Not the Original ResQme as advertised!
customer_reviews.text: I was led to believe that this is a ResQme original but it is not. The brand name is "Lifeguard" instead. FALSE ADVERTISING! I bought from Costco instead and the products I received from Costco are the ResQme Originals!
customer_reviews.author: PS Comment

customer_reviews.title: Nice and visible even though it's small
customer_reviews.text: Saw this on Southern Survival, where they were testing emergency glass breaking tools. The one I had (red hammer) broke before it got the glass out of the window - this worked in a single click, even when used with minimal force by a woman on the show (since I'm a woman, this was important to me!). Very bright color, hangs easily in view and packs a punch. Bought two more for my daughters!
customer_reviews.author: Karen C

customer_reviews.title: It definitely works
customer_reviews.text: I tried on a crusher bound Cadillac, an Audi, and a Buick. The Caddy required two hits and the Audi & Buick just one. The windows instantly disintegrated. A few inches from a corner works best. And yes, wear a glove if possible as another review mentioned because the falling glass probably going to scratch you. Try to position your arm & hand so that the window frame stops it from going into the window.
customer_reviews.author: Mike Connor

customer_reviews.title: This will save a life!
customer_reviews.text: I worked in the Fire Service my entire adult life. A seatbelt cutter with window punch can save not only your own life, but it can save the life of a child or animal left unattended in a scorching hot car, or someone involved a vehicle accident who is stuck inside and the car is on fire, or if someone ends up submerged in water. Is spending $12 worth saving a life? YES.
customer_reviews.author: Herb A. Genelly III

customer_reviews.title: Great tool for first responders
customer_reviews.text: I have used this tool numerous times to quickly and safely break open windows when responding to car accidents. I keep it on my keychain so it's always with me. I have yet to use the seat belt cutter tool so I can't speak to its functionality. The tool pops open side and rear windows quickly and almost effortlessly, allowing quick access to those inside, without swinging a hammer or anything else to break it open. It's a great thing to have with you all the time, because you never know.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: 3 of 4 were either failed on delivery or soon thereafter
customer_reviews.text: The initial package of two arrived with both springs failed and the devices unusable. Amazon cross-shipped another package of two. Within six weeks one of these had a spring failure, having done nothing more than dangle from a key chain. That upsets me. So much for Made In USA. That makes me sad.
customer_reviews.author: Texas T

customer_reviews.title: Great product!!
customer_reviews.text: This truly is a great product. I have been an EMT now for 7 years. So I wanted something small enough I could place in my pocket and carry all the time. This product is great for that. I now have two and my wife carries one. I have used mine a few times now and it always works flawlessly. If you want something that is dependable, yet small enough to place in a pocket or a purse this tool would work great for you.
customer_reviews.author: CPL.503

customer_reviews.title: Well made; inexpensive tool for peace of mind
customer_reviews.text: The only reason I didn’t give this an overall five star rating is because, while I tested it on a seatbelt, I have not tested it on a car window. The construction is excellent. I’ve tried the “lunch” function on a soda can and expect it’ll work fine on a tempered glass car window. At this prices, I bought one for every one of the six drivers in our extended family. Auto escapes are not just underwater as people expect. I got these after having to smash a card window with an axe to get a trapped person out.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Reitz

customer_reviews.title: Seems to work well, why wouldn't you have one handy?
customer_reviews.text: Seems to work well and is small and easy to keep handy. I don't have it on my keychain but have it in a secure place within reach of the driver's seat. I tested it on a block of regular pine 2x4 and it left a nice punch and wasn't difficult to push to fire the striker point. I'll likely order some more. Why doesn't everyone have one of these at this price? I've seen so many videos of people failing to break windows with repeated strikes from flashlights or batons and this would work so much better.
customer_reviews.author: Jay

customer_reviews.title: It doesn't fit on a keychain
customer_reviews.text: It doesn't actually fit on a keychain. That's the most important thing to know. I use a carabeener clip to keep it attached to my keys. The part where the knife to shatter the glass comes out requires a bit of pressure to work, so it's not for people with arthritis or other physical difficulty involving the hands. But it does keep that knife part safely away from random nicks. I haven't needed it in an emergency yet, hopefully I never do, but it's reassuring to have it just in case. If I ever need it, hopefully it works and I'll come back to update my review.
customer_reviews.author: HokieCarrie

customer_reviews.title: Just in case...
customer_reviews.text: Nobody in the family has had to use this yet, but we all have one JUST IN CASE! I like that this is small, can be carried with your keys (so they are always in the car) and it appears to be very easy to use. One part of the tool cuts the seat belt and the other part breaks the window. I've seen this product demonstrated on a video and very little force/strength is required to break the window. I bought extras of these and keep one in each passenger side car door. Carry one with you if you are a passenger in someone else's car. Just in case!
customer_reviews.author: Reign

customer_reviews.title: Did not hold up being kept on a key chain. Fell apart after a few months
customer_reviews.text: I bought one of these for each of my family. I carried mine on my key chain. I take it with me even when I am a passenger. I live where water is everywhere and there are many bridges. One day as I was riding over a bridge as a passenger I took mine out of my handbag to have it at the ready and lo an behold the pin had fallen out. Needless to say, I felt very vulnerable. I am now searching for a replacement and not sure I want to reorder this brand.
customer_reviews.author: reggie in tidewater virginia

customer_reviews.title: A must have for every family member!
customer_reviews.text: After seeing this product in action on Netflix's "Southern Survival" I purchased several as they will be X-mas gifts for the family. Light enough to be on your key chain and lots of colors from which to choose. The key ring attachment also serves as a cover so the blade is not exposed until needed! Great product and a inexpensive investment in your safety. Strongly recommend!
customer_reviews.author: SilverPanda79

customer_reviews.title: lightweight and great quality plastic and seatbelt cutter!
customer_reviews.text: I am giving this four stars without ever actually busting a window with it, but this product is very small and compact, with a seatbelt cutter that actually does work. I would advise you all though that if you are going to keep this and save it for a life threatening situation...then buy another one and go to a junk yard and bust a window to confirm that it actually works. But just having this seatbelt cutter on my keychain makes me feel safer already so I give it four stars. I will be buying another one soon to actually try he window punch and will update my review accordingly.
customer_reviews.author: Sean

customer_reviews.title: Is There No Quality Control?
customer_reviews.text: I just received these today and I am very disappointed. They came in a simple ziplock bag, no box, no instructions, no zip-tie. One was used; the razor is chiped, the pull can be taken off without strength and is loose fitting. The rear push for the spring-action window breaker is broken, and the bag it came in, as well as the broken ResQme, are dirty. I will be returning these. I didn't have a good day and this just did me in for the night.
customer_reviews.author: Denise Allawas

customer_reviews.title: Must have in every vehicle.
customer_reviews.text: I honestly dont know why everyone doesnt have one of these. Its stupid cheap and simple to operate. Go watch the videos of some putz trying to break a window with different things, its awful. Not these, break the window instantly with no effort. Comes with key ring and little ziptie. SECURE it where you can reach. It will save your live.
customer_reviews.author: Gene K

customer_reviews.title: Never hope to have to use:
customer_reviews.text: Bought these for my Teenage children Incase of emergencies we tested them out and the glsss breaking does work on picture frames... fingers crossed it does work on heavier glass if needed! You hope to never have to use life saving devices like thesr, but in the event you would need them at least they have them! They are super tiny so they barely even notice they are on their lanyards.
customer_reviews.author: Brandi Portell

customer_reviews.title: Very well built! It may save your life!
customer_reviews.text: This spring-loaded punch literally packs a punch! It WILL destroy your auto-glass! DO NOT attempt to test on tempered glass or any type of glass unless you want to destroy it! It will leave it a deep divot on a standard pad of paper! The seat beat cutter is very sharp! Highly recommended purchase! Comes with it's own key ring and Zip-Tie. Recommend to anchor/Zip-Tie the device somewhere within arms reach in case of life and death emergencies while stranded in vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: W. Ling

customer_reviews.title: WARNING: Not intended for use in research submersibles.
customer_reviews.text: I had the opportunity to use this while on an Uber Ride Share. I discovered the other passenger was a Trump supporter, so I fetched my resqme tool from my man satchel, quickly cut my seat belt, broke the side window, and crawled out to safety. I only got a few abrasions from the broken glass. The Uber driver was surprised that I didn't just release my seat belt, open the door, and leave. Drastic times call for drastic measures! Thank Beelzebub for the resqme car escape tool!
customer_reviews.author: Terry

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic 👍
customer_reviews.text: After seeing this product in action on Netflix's "Southern Survival"Light enough to be on your key chain and lots of colors from which to choose. The key ring attachment also serves as a cover so the blade is not exposed until needed! Great product and a inexpensive investment in your safety. Strongly recommend!👍
customer_reviews.author: KNIGHT

customer_reviews.title: Life Savers (literally)
customer_reviews.text: I legit saved the lives of two people on separate occasions with this thing. I’m a police officer for a hospital and on different occasions both people drove themselves to the emergency due to medical episodes (GSW, choking) both passed out and crashed. Doors were locked, both were non responsive. Used this tool to knock out the window, and pull them out. Both lived (GSW lost his leg though). Great tool. Not very effective on the front windows. At least from the outside. Still very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: Stark

customer_reviews.title: Needle is broken and was sent out defected.
customer_reviews.text: We received the device at the exact day it’s suppose to arrive, but this product that was placed in our order is defected and does NOT work. I am very unsatisfied That I was given a broken product in our purchase. It’s never been used before and I looked inside where you place the button onto the glass and there’s a needle that will puncture the glass that is broken and does not work. I am very upset that it was sent out before it was ever inspected. I was hoping I was able to use it incase of an emergency.
customer_reviews.author: Jen

customer_reviews.title: SAVES LIVES
customer_reviews.text: Here in Florida, we have water surrounding almost every highway. Every day, a car skids off the slick pavement and into the water or is involved in a major accident... and this tool is essential for the best chance at survival. It is small enough to attach to the keyring so you never lose it. In an emergency, gently press it against the corner of a side window and watch as the glass magically shatters allowing immediate escape from a submerging, crashed, trapped or on fire vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: RJ Smith - The Real RJ Smith

customer_reviews.title: Cool design lets you find it when you need it
customer_reviews.text: I've owned products like this for years, just to be ready if I ever plunge off a bridge into deep water, or get trapped by my seatbelt after a wreck. I've ignored the fact that I probably wouldn't be able to dig it out of a glove compartment or center console if I ever really needed it, especially if it was dark. With this product, you're provided a zip-tie that lets you hang it from your rear view mirror. With a sharp jerk, the business end (yellow part) can be unsheathed and used as intended. I still might freak-out and drown, but now I feel like I have a fighting chance. Kudos to the designers.
customer_reviews.author: Sinjin

customer_reviews.title: One of the two in the order does not work.
customer_reviews.text: I bought the two pack of this tool. The one seems to be in good shape and has a functioning spring mechanism, the other tool though has no spring resistance at all and despite the tool saying it can be used multiple times, I do not believe the one tool in this pack would work even once. I do not recommend purchasing this item because in the event of a life and death situation I do not believe this company’s version of the spring punch window break tool could be relied on to work as needed.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher J Smith

customer_reviews.title: NOT sturdy. Do not recommend.
customer_reviews.text: So disappointing . I had this on my key chain and I accidentally dropped my keys (I was bending over , it wasn’t even that far of a drop) and now it’s broken. You’re telling me this is supossed to save my life but can’t even handle a simple drop? No thanks . Go with a different manufacturer. Do NOT recommend .
customer_reviews.author: Kat

customer_reviews.title: Window breaker doesn’t work
customer_reviews.text: The entire reason that I got this was for the window breaker. I had to rescue a dog from a hot car over the summer in Las Vegas and the only way I was able to get it out was because someone else in the parking lot had a window breaker tool. I wanted to make sure I was prepared if I was ever in that situation again. I tested this out on a thin glass cup and it didn’t even work. I tried six times, you can see the punch marks but it never cracked the glass
customer_reviews.author: Shannon L. Bernier

customer_reviews.title: Greatest Invention Ever
customer_reviews.text: Don't know how I went so long with out these in my truck. Not a whole lot to say other than they are cheap insurance should something ever go really bad. These are the best vehicle safety devices I've seen. Tie them on around the shoulder guide of the seat belt on either side of the front seats and they are always available to anyone sitting in the front or back. Then you don't have to worry about where they will be after stuff goes flying in a wreck like some other safety devices that are larger and just sit in a cup holder or center console.
customer_reviews.author: The Angelo Kid

customer_reviews.title: Hope you won't need it!
customer_reviews.text: Hope we never have to use them, but for the price, it's cheap insurance if you need to escape OR help extract yourself or someone else from an auto accident. Seem well made, and the built in strap cutter seems sharp enough for the job. The spring loaded punch should work well based on video I've watched. Definitely one of the "hope I'll never need it but will be glad I had it" item should the need arise. I bought the 2-pack in yellow, and they stay securely on our key rings.
customer_reviews.author: PrimeJunkie

customer_reviews.title: Great for emergency
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my daughter and son in law. I can’t comment on how good/bad they are because they haven’t had to use them, and hopefully won’t. I bought these as a preventative. My daughter recently was caught in flood waters and to hear the terror in her voice as the water was coming into the car and her panicking because she couldn’t get her seatbelt off. She was rescued, the car totaled, and I ordered these the next day
customer_reviews.author: Bettina

customer_reviews.title: Convenient little gadget!
customer_reviews.text: I tied one of these with paracord to the center console shifter knob in my car, so it's right there and ready to grab if I need it. Just a quick tug and it easily pops off, but it attaches securely enough that I'm very confident it would not come off on its own in a crash - it isn't heavy enough to pop itself free like that. As this is something that is kind of difficult to test... I'm keeping it there and hoping I never need to use it, and hoping it works if I do need it. :)
customer_reviews.author: Jason

customer_reviews.title: MUST HAVE FOR EVERYONE
customer_reviews.text: Everyone in my house was given one or two. They've been ziptied inside cars, and some carry them on their keychain. I've never had the opportunity to use the glass breaker, but I've used the seat belt cutter so many times, because in times I've needed a scissor or a knife, they've successfully been useful. Also, when I went through airports, I was only asked about it once out of the fifty times I've gone, and they were like "cool".
customer_reviews.author: Iron American

customer_reviews.title: I hope to never use this.
customer_reviews.text: I have this hanging from my rear view mirror via a zip tie. The blade is sharp and the clip that protects you from it is actually the keychain piece. So the keyring is on the zip tie and you have to pull strongly to get it off the clip. The pin for actually breaking glass is on a strong spring and is deployable repeatedly. I recommend having it in your car where it cant be bounced around and you can get to it.
customer_reviews.author: Meijhana

customer_reviews.title: Smart Design
customer_reviews.text: It's really smart to make this product small enough to put onto a key chain. I chose to hang it from my rear view mirror because, in a crash, with the airbag deployed, I imagine it would be difficult to reach the ignition but easier to reach the device hanging from the mirror. It's small enough to be unobtrusive. I don't even notice it there. We tested it on a block of wood, as suggested by another review. They worked perfectly first time. The price is good for two devices packaged together.
customer_reviews.author: TL in SB

customer_reviews.title: Have not used the cutter part but its nice to have it there
customer_reviews.text: I work in public safety and have used these more than once on the job to break windows. They do it right every time, much more reliable that smashing at tempered auto glass with a flashlight or nightstick (and more control over where the shattered glass goes too). Have not used the cutter part but its nice to have it there. I carry these on all my sets of keys now.
customer_reviews.author: MerAngler

customer_reviews.title: When I needed it...
customer_reviews.text: I kept this in my car for emergencies. When there was an emergency, I thought I could help. Turns out nothing worked correctly and I felt a fool trying to make it work. DON'T BUY!
customer_reviews.author: YNGuitar

customer_reviews.title: Great tool.  Must have for public safety.
customer_reviews.text: I work in Public Safety. This is a good tool. It’s compact enough to fit in you cargo pocket without taking up much room. It’s well made and I’ve used it several times to break windows and cut a couple belts. BEWARE: A number of newer cars use laminated glass in the side windows. This tool will not break this type of glass. This tool works great on tempered glass. But if you’re thinking of getting this as a personal escape tool make sure you do not have laminate side windows in your car
customer_reviews.author: Jeff Davis

customer_reviews.title: Cheaply made
customer_reviews.text: God forbid u actually get into an accident and have to use this item. It's nearly impossible to pull the belt slicer guard off. I'm guessing a spike is suppose to come out to break the window when you press the button. Unfortunately you have to have the strength of Hercules to make that happen, which I could not. Very rigid device. You'll probably drown before you get it to function.
customer_reviews.author: Rae

customer_reviews.title: Must have in your keychain!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this in 2008 (Royal Blue) and have been carrying in my keychain ever since. This is something that you hope never have to use. I can attest to the sharpness of the knife as I was able to cut heavy clothing and tarp using the spare. I'm concerned about some reviews stating the spring loaded tool not working, so, I also keep a manual hammer tool in the glove box.
customer_reviews.author: Folsom DIY Fan

customer_reviews.title: Nice and useful
customer_reviews.text: I like the idea and size. It comes with a wire tie and key chain ring. It fits on the palm of your hand (a bit smaller even) - well, I have small hands too! I hope you will never need to use, but it is a great gift item and to keep around in the car - for sure! I did try the window breaker on a metal door, just to feel the impact. It did make a tiny hole on the metal door and I heard and felt it deploying. You don't have to push too hard and since it is sharp and straight (the little thing that shoots from inside) it will break any window!
customer_reviews.author: anakonda

customer_reviews.title: Small Life Saving Tool EVERYONE Should Get
customer_reviews.text: I have not had to use this yet but I firmly believe that this is a small yet extremely smart life saving device. I keep it on my key chain in the event I ever need to cut myself out of my seatbelt and/or smash my window to escape a life threatening situation. I gave the second one to my best friend and she also keeps it on her key chain. It’s a very small and lightweight item but I view it almost as an additional insurance because you never know when you might be in a situation where this could save your life and/or someone else’s.
customer_reviews.author: IOweAmazonMyFirstBorn

customer_reviews.title: Good product.
customer_reviews.text: These are totally awesome. We tested them out the day they got here, and they do exactly what they say they do. I pray I never need to use them, but what a tiny anxiety-lifter it is knowing they're in the car with us just in case.
customer_reviews.author: PromiseJubilee

customer_reviews.title: Best device for the job.
customer_reviews.text: This is a VERY well designed gadget. The blade cuts very nicely, and the glass breaker is highly effective, yet leaves no exposed sharp points or edges. It fits on a keychain, and is easy to remove yet stays secure when you want it to. I EDC a good pocket knife and a tactical pen, but if I'm ever in a car wreck I will reach for this. I keep it attached to my car keys, and it's easy to remove from the keychain with the keys still in the ignition. I think everyone should have one of these. I went with the yellow because it makes my car keys harder to misplace.
customer_reviews.author: CC

customer_reviews.title: TEST IT - FAULTY
customer_reviews.text: I just received these, I grabbed a cardboard box and tested the glass breaker. I mainly wanted to see how hard you had to push before the breaker point engaged. It worked fine the first time, then the second time, it no longer works. The black push-button part goes all the way down and the breaker never springs out. THANK GOD THIS WASN'T IN A SERIOUS CIRCUMSTANCE... Not impressed as this could have easily put my families lives in jeopardy.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Jensen

customer_reviews.title: Better safe than sorry
customer_reviews.text: I use to have a different tool that was meant to break a window and cut a seat belt in the event of an emergency; I watched some comparison reviews and this out-performed the hammer style tool I had before. I like that it's so small that I can keep it on my keychain. Luckily I haven't had to use it, but it seems much simpler with the mechanism that breaks the glass.
customer_reviews.author: LV

customer_reviews.title: Must have for all your vehicles
customer_reviews.text: These are very small and light yet could save your life make great gifts should have one per vehicle attached to something where you can reach it because in a rollover everything in the car will fly everywhere been there done that!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great product
customer_reviews.text: I seen this product on a Netflix series and decided to buy it and try it out myself. Me and my girlfriend went to a local junk yard and tried it. Works amazingly. Would recommend this to anyone. Very easy to use. There is a video of my girlfriend doing it and she even said its great.
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth Clement

customer_reviews.title: Didn't hold up to normal wear and tear
customer_reviews.text: Never had a chance to use this tool (thank God) however its durability is questionable. Had it attached to my regular keychain for the past 3 1/2 years and it became defective. You would push the button in and it wouldn't do anything. The spring or coil inside would no longer work. If you buy this and carry it and rely on it, I would test it every so often to insure it is still functional. The price is low enough to buy another one though. $10 every 3-4 years isn't so bad for piece of kind. I might buy another one or transition to a more reliable tool.
customer_reviews.author: D. P.

customer_reviews.title: Works like a charm!!!! ✨
customer_reviews.text: What can I say? Hmmmmm, this item works wonderfully. I was very hesitant to use it. I never thought such a small tool would be able to break through glass. Pushing through slowly will immediately shatter all the glass in the frame, but it is not yet breaking. Then pushing a little further will destroy the entire glass making your fist go through. Does it hurt at all? No. Worth the purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Luisa Villegas

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Safety Device
customer_reviews.text: I saw these on a survival show on tv and they just made sense to me. Hopefully I will never need them but we have them in each car now They are well made and easy to use and remove from there built in hanger bracket. We put them up on the drivers visor in both of our cars so reaching for them would not be confusing. I think everyone should have them
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: It's better than nothing
customer_reviews.text: I've had a couple of these for a couple years and they can save your life. Sadly, the glass break tip cover recently came off and I was unable to get it back on. So I went ahead and ordered four more as they can indeed save your life. However, don't expect them to last forever as they are made out of brittle plastic and the components don't stay intact for too long.
customer_reviews.author: Ms. Daisy

customer_reviews.title: One came broken
customer_reviews.text: I bought the 2 pack so my husband could have one in his car and I could have one in mine...but one came broken. The pin had already been activated and had nothing holding it from free floating. Hope I never have to use the one that was not broken, but i'm still glad I have something in the car in case of an emergency that would need something like this.
customer_reviews.author: Samantha Ruberti

customer_reviews.title: Breaks tempered glass perfectly and effortlessly
customer_reviews.text: It fits right my keychain, is lightweight but well built. Its easy to detach but with not detach accidentally. Most importantly in my test on some tempered glass from an old oven it worked perfectly (Tempered glass is what car windshields are made from). The glass immediately shattered into thousands of tiny pieces. I haven't tested the seat belt cutter yet, but I can say that the glass breaker works very well. It is small but mighty!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Had a bad dream!
customer_reviews.text: I had a bad dream one night that I was in a car drowning could get out of the car. It was really weird! I decided to take a mental note of it and decided to buy these. It has great reviews and the videos show it working well. It has a seatbelt cutter and a window breaker. It cam with a ziplock that I have tied around my rear view mirror! I haven't tested it yet but I will.
customer_reviews.author: Ryan Corry

customer_reviews.title: Junk Junk Junk Junk Junk
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT purchase this item. I bought a set for my family. The one broke literally the day I put it on my keychain, the other a few days later. As a retired cop I want a product I can depend on, couldn’t imagine getting into an accident and find the innerds of the mechanism are gone.
customer_reviews.author: Jay Sheets

customer_reviews.title: A great device you hope you'll never have to use
customer_reviews.text: Got these as Christmas gifts for family and friends. Fortunately no one has had to use them yet. Pressing one into a piece of wood makes a nice dent, so it seems like they'll work if/when the time comes. I suppose if you want to be sure you could test it on your irritating neighbor's car... JUST KIDDING, don't do that (test it on your boss' car instead). This is one of those devices you don't think (or at least hope) you'll ever need, but they're cheap enough that you should get one anyway. Because having one and not needing it is a lot better than needing one and not having it.
customer_reviews.author: TinyZombie

customer_reviews.title: GET AT LEAST ONE
customer_reviews.text: EVERYONE needs at least one of these in their vehicle. I bought one for my patrol vehicle. Then I bought 4 more for the rest of my family to use in their vehicles. This things is lightweight. Easy to attach and remove, but not TOO easy to remove in case you are worried about it just falling off. I DEFINITELY RECOMMEND!
customer_reviews.author: Craig M.

customer_reviews.title: or somewhere within easy reach of the driver seat)
customer_reviews.text: This thing functions well but it's kind of flimsy. If you keep it on your "daily use" keychain it will break within a few months due to normal key-usage wear and tear. It will last longer if you attach it somewhere semi-permanent (like next to your steering wheel, or somewhere within easy reach of the driver seat). Mine broke and I never ordered a replacement, so hopefully some day I'm not pinned in my vehicle at the bottom of a ravine, and my last thought as the water level rises past my nostrils is "Gee, I sure wish I ordered another resqme tool instead of just leaving a snarky review."
customer_reviews.author: Owen

customer_reviews.title: Good Car Emergency tool - A must have product
customer_reviews.text: I bought these for my car to use it in case of an emergency. It is very sleek and looks very good. I hung it in the headrest. I accidentally hit my finger when I tried to learn how to use the glass breaking task (Pushed the black circle with my hand and got a hit) I have not used this product to test it and praying that I will never to use it :) There are many products like this one. This was a cheaper one.
customer_reviews.author: NilatS

customer_reviews.title: HIGHLY DISSAPOINTED - Bought 1 pack (2 items) and do not work both !!
customer_reviews.text: I bought 1 pack (one for me and my wife) 2 years ago; keeping them in our key chains until needed. I decided to give a test to see how they work .........oh surprise, unfortunately both do not work at all !! RESQME ORANGE - TWIN PACK bar code: 6 30932 02542 2
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: I have every confidence that this tool will do what it is supposed to should the need arise.
customer_reviews.text: I can't give a 100% review on these because thankfully I haven't needed to use one yet, however, I can answer some basic questions. They are pretty small, definitely fit onto a key chain and no sharp or excessively pointy parts. The detachable clip is strong and quite secure. The tool should not ever come lose unless you want it to. Cut seat belts at an angle. Pop side windows and do so in a corner of the window. Check out videos online of how to use this product. Should you get into a wreck and if you can reach this tool it should definitely help you out.
customer_reviews.author: Geoffrey A. Sergeant

customer_reviews.title: Initial build quality seems good. Used the included zip ties to mount on ...
customer_reviews.text: Initial build quality seems good. Used the included zip ties to mount on the emergency brake lever in both my vehicles. I don't think you would have to worry about the black safety piece separating from the device unintentionally. It is very secure, but also easy to remove when needed. Punch is easy to activate. Ease of use is paramount in emergency equipment like this. I would recommend a punch type versus a hammer type window breaker.
customer_reviews.author: Cody Cochran

customer_reviews.title: This is as important as your first aid kit. BUY IT.
customer_reviews.text: I guess I'll never know how great this tool is until I have to use it. I hope I never will. Buy one for each of your cars. The two I bought did not come with a sun visor clip, but they are available. This can be a life saver for you and your family, but you could save the life of a child or dog in a hot car too. Make sure you see the demonstration on You Tube I'm buying 6 more, for my three adult kids. Don't wait till Christmas.
customer_reviews.author: Michael

customer_reviews.title: Wew baby this thing works.
customer_reviews.text: Ole son if you want something to pop out the window in your ride incase you turn the old 1993 danger ranger over for the 23rd time on the whoopty doos at the atv track this is the device to buy. However don’t try the monster out on your wife’s brand new Honda Pilot mini van driver side window it’ll sure land you several days in the dog house until you replace it.
customer_reviews.author: Colby cot

customer_reviews.title: design flaw
customer_reviews.text: "Please note that without support of key ring or the cable tie it can be a little difficult to remove the blade clip and can cause the resqme to break." mine broke. the thin arm won't withstand an angle. this is a known design flaw. in an emergency, you can end up with an unguarded razor blade. thanks for nothing.
customer_reviews.author: jc

customer_reviews.title: Good to have!
customer_reviews.text: I bought this as I believe everyone should have it in their car, you truly never know what could happen. My only concern is I don't have a key, instead my car keys need to be in the car and I have push button start. So if I were to get into an accident my keys would go flying and I'd never find this to get out. I have put it in my center console so I at least know where it is. But it might be nice to have some sort of clip on it so it can be attached to the visor or something....just a thought.
customer_reviews.author: Darcie Hill

customer_reviews.title: A must have for your key rings
customer_reviews.text: I think that this is quite a handy little safety tool to have just in case. It goes right on your key ring so that in the event of a car emergency, you just grab it and pull it off of its attached clip. Then you can use it to either break the glass or cut the seatbelt. I have purchased several of these over the years and even my oldest one has held up well. The clip that attaches it still securely holds onto it without worry. It is priced right, comes in a multitude of colors and makes a great gift for family and friends.
customer_reviews.author: Henry Family

customer_reviews.title: NOT GENUINE - CHEAP JUNK!
customer_reviews.text: The item I received is NOT a REAL ResQ Me! I bought these to replace one I’ve had for a long time due to the blade rusting, and the item I received is a cheap piece of knock off junk. No branding anywhere on it. Feels brittle and flimsy, and and overall cheap. Will be returning and requesting refund.
customer_reviews.author: Carl H.

customer_reviews.title: From what I have seen, excellent quality with one caveat
customer_reviews.text: These seem to be excellent quality, I bought them when they were on sale I don't regret it. There is one caveat, when you test the glass breaking feature, use a glove or towel between your thumb and tool. The action is quite powerful and stings the thumb a bit, a bit like a bee sting. Definitely don't want kids to get a hold of these, but then again the action is quite stiff so they will probably not be able to make it work correctly.
customer_reviews.author: Drue J. Deshotels

customer_reviews.title: Exactly what I was looking for.
customer_reviews.text: They were exactly what I was looking for. Got it for the car just in case. I like to be prepared and these had great reviews and I saw them on a show where they tried them out compared to similar products and these worked the best. If I ever have to use it I will let you know but hopefully I don’t lol😁
customer_reviews.author: Nichole

customer_reviews.title: Great quick-access design.
customer_reviews.text: Great design. It allows the user to simply yank it free from it's quick-disconnect mount to allow for use of the seat belt razor blade--blade remains safely within a slotted opening even after removal of the tool. Just tie them to rear-view mirror mounts in our cars and gave several to family members. My wife didn't like the orange in her car, though I love it in my truck. So I bought the black set as well, for her. Highly recommended peace of mind.
customer_reviews.author: John Galt Adams

customer_reviews.title: You will die trying to remove it from the clip.
customer_reviews.text: Serious design flaw. It’s practically impossible to remove the tool from the clip, which is needed to protect you and anyone in your car who finds it from the seatbelt-cutting blade and if you want to hang it. I wasn’t planning on using the key ring because it could take too long to locate my keys. I will be returning this.
customer_reviews.author: JB

customer_reviews.title: Amazing how well these work.
customer_reviews.text: Bought these after watching an episode of Southern Survival-- a show that tests survival gear. These are also sold on their site Battlebotsstore, but the Amazon price was cheaper and shipping quicker. Also gave them as a gift to my son who turned me on to the very-entertaining and informative program.
customer_reviews.author: Nevadaflyboy

customer_reviews.title: I haven't used it but it seems good.
customer_reviews.text: Hopefully, I won't ever need to use this device. Apparently, none of these really work on new, high end cars with laminated side glass. They will only break tempered glass windows. You can tell what kind of side window glass you have by reading the fine print etched on the bottom edge of the window. It will say whether it is tempered or laminated glass.
customer_reviews.author: David Brooks

customer_reviews.title: Lasted for 5 years of being carried on my keychain.
customer_reviews.text: I have had this for about 5 years now and it finally stopped working. The spring eventually became loose and fell out of place. Not so much from regular usage. I am going to guess that it was from carrying it around my keychain all these years. For the times that I did use it, it worked flawlessly. They do not last forever, unfortunately. So make sure to occasionally check them in case they need to be replaced.
customer_reviews.author: OS Gamer

customer_reviews.title: Won't Work On Two Of My Three Cars--Tempered Vs Laminated Glass--Research First!!
customer_reviews.text: Resque works only on tempered glass--not laminated glass. The instructions that come with the product (which you get AFTER you buy it) clearly say so. I found a website that showed which cars have tempered glass and which cars have laminated glass. Many many modern US cars have laminated glass on their side windows. I found the seller not mentioning this lacking (at best) and skanky (at worst)...
customer_reviews.author: Clint

customer_reviews.title: looks good, hopefully also works as the youtube shows.
customer_reviews.text: Delivered on time. Looks like a good product. Im not able to tell much about the functionality yet because luckily I did not have to use it yet and I do not have any spare windows on my house and also do not want to test it on windows of my neighbours, they would be not happy ;) You can check youtube, there are tons of videos how this thing works so you can see it should be a very good product. Thank you for a increasing my chance to survive in a case of an accident.
customer_reviews.author: happy client

customer_reviews.title: You won't be left in a car by a Kennedy to asphyxiate with this puppy
customer_reviews.text: With extreme inclement weather due to climate change, and serial killers popping up all over the place, I recommend having one of these in every car.
customer_reviews.author: Rebecca

customer_reviews.title: Great safety tool
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little glass breaker. I did a few test strikes on a piece of steel. The resulting divots left me convinced that it would easily shatter a tempered glass vehicle side window. The instructions recommend hanging it from the rear view mirror but the resulting rattling made me decide to put it in another location. Overall I recommend this product.
customer_reviews.author: Jdunk2145

customer_reviews.title: TEMPERATURE MAY KILLL IT
customer_reviews.text: I don't want to attach this to my keychain so I used velcro to stick this onto the side of seats. Yesterday I found out that the internal locking mechanism had failed. the punch pin tip protrude out all the time. I guess its due to the hot sun ( I live in Houston). The spring has tension and the heat soften the plastic. However I think it still functional, all I need is that hardened tip. So don't leave this in the car, the heat will cause a failure.
customer_reviews.author: Lamborbikini

customer_reviews.title: Can't trust it.
customer_reviews.text: I work in law enforcement. I've been carrying a Resqme for a few months as an alternative to using a baton to break windows. The time came to break a car window last night and the Resqme failed. I tested it after and realized that the glass breaker wasn't even coming out of the body of the tool. Can't trust it - won't ever own another.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy

customer_reviews.title: AWESOME, WORKS ASTONISHINGLY WELL, USED ON SCENE AND PROVEN
customer_reviews.text: THIS PRODUCT ACTUALLY WORKS!! I am very impressed and pleased with the function of this tool. I was on scene with this tool and gained entry to a vehicle within seconds. I have never seen a glass breaking tool work so well in my life. And the seat-belt cutter? Oh boy, it cuts like butter. I recommend this tool for everyone, civilians, EMS, FIRE, POLICE. This is a must have! I am buying more for family and for work. One of the best parts is they are totally affordable, I can buy one for the whole family without breaking the bank.
customer_reviews.author: J. Dugan

customer_reviews.title: Break and Cut
customer_reviews.text: Five stars would have been given, If I had used it. This unit looks like it would do as designed. Hope I never have to use it. The instructions and video were very well produced. Compact but easy to find, if you don't have Alzheimer. Sorry, but I am almost there. Recommended.
customer_reviews.author: truckerloyd

customer_reviews.title: A must tool to have for a CPST
customer_reviews.text: I am a certified CPST (Child Passenger Safety Technician). I bought this to always have in my purse for possible emergencies. Whether I need to cut seat belt straps or break a window to save a life. I certisnly hope I will never have to use it but I want to be prepared if I do. This is very small I have it clipped to the inside of my purse on the key clip built into the purse. This is never in my way but easily accessible. I like the safety device built into it to keep the blade safe from hands. I reach in and out of my purse without any stress that I will ever be cut.
customer_reviews.author: ca.roybal

customer_reviews.title: Good for Emergencies
customer_reviews.text: I hung up the two tools on the pegs for my visors, and they are easily accessible there. Don't distract or anything, and they will be right there should I, or my passenger, ever need them. I haven't used the window breaker or the seat belt cutter yet, as I don't have any spare car windows or seat belts hanging around, but TheUrbanPrepper tested them on his channel and they worked perfectly. Edit: I am using the included zip tie loops to hang the two Resqmes, and they work nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Ana

customer_reviews.title: TSA approved? Sure I guess
customer_reviews.text: I've only used it on some paper, and an old mirror I was throwing away. Idk if its TSA approved or not really, but I travel a bit for work. Last few trips, I didnt even think about leaving it behind and realized on the other side of TSA they hadnt said a thing or looked at it twice so...approved I guess
customer_reviews.author: jsherriff

product_meta.title: RESQME Family Pack of 3, The Original Emergency Keychain Car Escape Tool, 2-in-1 Seatbelt Cutter and Window Breaker, Made in USA, Black, Blue, Safety Yellow
product_meta.description: Size:3 Pack| Color:Black, Blue, Safety Yellowresqme - the original quick car escape tool made in the USA. Seatbelt cutter & window breaker -family pack of 3: Black, Blue, Safety Yellow.
feature_bullets: Seat belt cutter + car window breaker

specifications.Customer Reviews: 4.6 out of 5 stars10,749 ratings4.6 out of 5 stars
